timeline.bodyText: This is a public method, so you can't necessarily make this assumption.
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText: The change is moved to the BatchFinderResponseBuilder class now, and it is only limited in that class use case
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText: Is this extra logic necessary? Isn't the parsed mask tree available in the response builder?
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText: yes, you are right,  the mastrees are generated during the class ResourceContextImpl constructor, so to avoid this extra step, I just need a reference from ResourceContextImpl instance
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText: Once again, this method is public so you should be careful about changing behavior.
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText: yes, it is resolved
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText: Agree with Evan, also the projection parameters are already available as MaskTree in resourContext. So a better fix would be to update the buildCriteriaURI() method in BatchFinderResponseBuilder to replace the projection params with masktree objects.
timeline.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: Yes, changed the way I extract projection MaskTree by directly referencing those projection fields which already in ResourceContextImpl
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.message: When server builds URI and projection fields are included, convert raw string to MaskTree
When server builds URI and projection fields are included, convert raw string to MaskTree

timeline.bodyText: You should create a copy instead of modifying the underlying parameters. There might be logic elsewhere (and custom filter) that depend on these parameters parsed from URI.
timeline.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: Got it, DataMap has two copy related method, clone and copy, the clone seems to be a shallow copy and the copy seems to be suit for this use case
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.message: When server builds URI and projection fields are included, convert raw string to MaskTree

timeline.bodyText: Deep copy might be expensive and for this usecase, a shallow copy is sufficient.
timeline.author: karthikbalasub

timeline.bodyText: This is not a good way to recover this error. I'd prefer failing the request as this is unexpected.
timeline.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: Instead of copy I used clone, according to the comment and short code trace, clone should be the shallow copy
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText:

Be real batch criterias at all (just single criteria) I will add to later test

timeline.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText:
In this part of error handling, because I don't expect to change all the callers of buildCriteriaURI with throws
so I instead throws a RuntimeException
timeline.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: I think throwing a RestLiServiceException with 500 status code and cleaner error message would be good here. For reference you can check the other response builders.
replies.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: I just fixed it, one point I am curious is that, for each entry in the batch, is it better to put in 500 error code for each entry, or just fail the whole batch in one 500 code?
replies.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: For this, just one 500 error is fine. The paging parameters are common for all criteria.
replies.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: got it I will make another change then, right now i put failure in one entry, the other will continue to process or they will generate another 500.
replies.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: @karthikbalasub , all the changes regarding clone and exception handling are reverted since I use a simpler way to address the original issue
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText: Why is this an array instead of a constant? Will we have more values here?
timeline.author: karthikrg

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it is an array because I found we have two protocol versions in the code. So I assume it is needed to test in both protocol versions.
replies.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: The detail is, if there exists some http client and it send a request with a http header saying it is protocol version 100, then our ResourceContextImpl class internally will parse query parameters differently.
replies.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: I understand that we need to support both 1.0 and 2.0, however all your array values are 2.0
replies.author: karthikrg

replies.bodyText: yes, I met some issues where it only happens in 1.0 so I will include that fix in this PR and then that is complete
replies.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: As we discussed, let us get the fix in for the projection issue with protocol 2.0.0 support and raise a separate PR for 1.0.0 issue.
replies.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: yes, the 1.0.0 part of the issue is long existing one
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText:
Note the original case's %3B became ;
that is minor but I just want to highlight it in case something is wrong
timeline.author: BrianPin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -341,4 +344,81 @@ private static Foo generateMetaData(Boolean onError)
     Foo foo = new Foo(map);
     return foo;
   }
+
+  @DataProvider(name = "build_uri_test_cases")

+  {
+    String[] requestURIs =
+    {
+        "/greetings?bq=searchGreetings&criteria=List((id:1,tone:SINCERE))&message=hello",
+        "/talent/api/talentHiringProjectCandidates?bq=candidates&candidates=List((candidate:urn%3Ali%3Ats_hire_identity%3A88156577))",

+    };
+

+        "candidates",
+        "candidates",
+        "candidates",

timeline.message: When server builds URI and projection fields are included, convert raw string to MaskTree

timeline.bodyText: If I remember correctly, you do not have to do this. You can just throw a RestLiServiceException with 500 status from within extractQueryParamsFromResourceContext method and the framework should convert that into an error response.
timeline.author: karthikbalasub

replies.bodyText: Sounds good
replies.author: BrianPin

replies.bodyText: I addressed the original issue with another simpler approach, so returning 500 as server side error is not needed now
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText: I'd suggest making private methods package-private if they need to be accessed by a unit test. Making it protected opens the access too much and implies an intended inheritance relationship.
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText: nit: fix spacing
timeline.author: evanw555

timeline.bodyText:
Wrapping so much logic here in a try-catch is excessive and makes it harder to understand.
Given that the resulting service error says that the error happens because Rest.li was unable to build the criteria URI, it makes sense to me to actually put this try-catch and service error inside #buildCriteriaURI
timeline.author: evanw555
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -105,45 +107,52 @@ public RestLiResponse buildResponse(RoutingResult routingResult,
     TimingContextUtil.beginTiming(routingResult.getContext().getRawRequestContext(),
         FrameworkTimingKeys.SERVER_RESPONSE_RESTLI_PROJECTION_APPLY.key());
 
-    for (Object criteriaParam : criteriaParams.values())
+    try

replies.bodyText: As we discussed earlier, this logic is not needed since we addressed the problem in the other way
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.bodyText:
Using try-catches to dictate normal logic flow (rather than just for exceptions) is bad practice. I would suggest retrieving the generic object from the map and checking its type.
Overall though this is better IMO.
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText: Thanks for the advice, fixed it.
replies.author: BrianPin

timeline.message: Address comment on class cases handling

timeline.bodyText:
Minor comments:

Add a final else case which throws an exception. If one of these projection params is present but is not a string or data map, then it should be treated as an illegal argument.
A minor optimization could be made here. You have 4 different get accessor calls here, you could do one initial get then perform the checks/casting on that object.
timeline.author: evanw555

replies.bodyText: Fixed
replies.author: BrianPin
